channel.title: Password Changing on me?
channel.description:
Hey guys, I'm pretty new to this whole editing server/client. I'm getting a problem where if I log on to this client, and If I log out the passwords in the 'characters' folder will change automatically to a long series of numbers, which obviously, doesn't allow me to log in. Even if I change it back, It doesn't take effect on the client itself after compiling so I can't log in.
Help would be greatly appreciated.

item.title: Password Changing on me?
item.dc:creator: @DivineSouls DivineSouls
item.description:
@DivineSouls wrote:

hmm, I think I fixed it, I replaced the compiler inside the source with another one that I had which is a lot better. Now I can log in without having my passwords changed, the password in the characters list still shows HEX, but allows me to log in.

Read full topic

item.title: Password Changing on me?
item.dc:creator: @DivineSouls DivineSouls
item.description:
@DivineSouls wrote:

@echo off
color 0a
title Unlimited-pkz Compiler
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo You have sucsessfully compiled
pause
exit

Here’s the coding to the compiler? see anything wrong with it?

Read full topic

ohh that…yah idk that one… thought it was useng hex but thats not hex thats its own lil thing. its not alt commands…hmmm. i have no clue…maybe you should use a diffrent source?

item.title: Password Changing on me?
item.dc:creator: @DivineSouls DivineSouls
item.description:
@DivineSouls wrote:

Ok this is what i did, i deleted everything, than installed it, logged in and out a couple times, didn’t change the password, but as soon as I compiled it (without changing anything) Boom. Passwords changed.

69-231-242-97-166-94-172-141-101-47-229-57-150-190-100-130

There’s one of them.

Read full topic

item.title: Password Changing on me?
item.dc:creator: @DivineSouls DivineSouls
item.description:
@DivineSouls wrote:

Yes, I compile it successfully.

Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
You have sucsessfully compiled
Press any key to continue . . .

After that, I try to log in, doesn’t work. Look at my ‘characters’ list.

I’ll get a large series of numbers, which apparently are called ‘HEX numbers’

Even if I change it back to my previous password, still won’t allow me to log in

Read full topic

item.title: Password Changing on me?
item.dc:creator: @jaloko jaloko
item.description:
@jaloko wrote:

So to be clear, you work on stuff, compile it SUCCESSFULLY with out any errors? and it resets your password? hmm ive never heard of that.

Read full topic

item.title: Password Changing on me?
item.dc:creator: @DivineSouls DivineSouls
item.description:
@DivineSouls wrote:

No I can’t, that’s the problem, I’ll login the first time…work a little bit, nothing big or anything, keep in mind i’m a beginner. I’ll compile it all, go to the login screen and it won’t allow me to log in.

Read full topic

item.title: Password Changing on me?
item.dc:creator: @jaloko jaloko
item.description:
@jaloko wrote:

Those long series of numbers are HEX numbers which represent letters…kinda like WEP keys for your wireless security. can you sign in with the same password you made with the name?

Read full topic
